assessments.task_description:
This component requires a 10 minute in-class oral presentation in German, to be written up as a 250-word written summary (also in German) after the presentation. Both the presentation and the summary are to focus on one poem by Goethe only. In the oral part of the presentation you may refer to notes, but do not merely read them out aloud.

Your presentation (and the subsequent write-up of the presentation) should answer directly the four questions that appear below:

1. Wann hat Goethe dieses Gedicht geschrieben? 2. Wo/wann/in welchem Umfeld/Kontext spielt das Gedicht? 3. Was thematisiert das Gedicht? 4. Was möchte der Dichter mit dem Gedicht sagen?

The 10 minute presentation is to be completed in class between Week 3 and Week 5. Students may present a maximum of 10 powerpoint slides during the presentation.

The 250-word summary in German is to be submitted no later than 5pm on March 27, 2026 and is to be submitted via Turnitin. No bibliography is required, but a brief list of references may be included if you have referred to one or more secondary readings in your presentation.

The grading criteria for the presentation and summary can be found in Blackboard Assesment Folder (GRMN3330 Presentation Write-Up Rubric).

Sign up for your presentation in class after consulting the lecturer.

Use of Generative AI & MT:

The oral, in-class presentation of a poem in German is to be completed in-person. The use of generative Artificial Intelligence (AI) or Machine Translation (MT) tools will not be permitted. Any attempted use of AI or MT may constitute student misconduct under the Student Code of Conduct.

For the written submission, students may appropriately use AI and/or MT in completing this assessment task. Students must clearly reference any use of AI or MT in each instance. A failure to reference generative AI or MT use may constitute student misconduct under the Student Code of Conduct.
assessments.submission_guidelines: The 250-word summary in German is to be submitted no later than 5pm on March 27, 2026 and is to be submitted via Turnitin. No bibliography is required, but a brief list of references may be included if you have referred to one or more secondary readings in your presentation.

assessments.task_description:
The exam will be conducted in-class in Week 9 and will last up to 90 minutes.

What is involved? The exam will have two parts. The first part of the exam will focus on questions relating to the narrative plot. These questions are to be answered in German. The second part of the exam will focus on questions of interpretation. Students may answer this part of the exam in English or German.

No bibliography for this task is required.
